{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the description provided, the lesion on the cheek with raised, pearly borders and telangiectasias on the surface is highly suggestive of a basal cell carcinoma. Basal cell carcinoma is the most common type of skin cancer and typically presents with these characteristics. Squamous cell carcinoma may also present as a raised lesion, but it is less likely to have pearly borders and telangiectasias. WAS (Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome) is a genetic disorder that affects the immune system and is not related to the presentation described. Actinic keratosis is a precancerous skin condition characterized by rough, scaly patches on the skin, and it does not typically have the specific features mentioned in the question.", "answer_choice": "A. Basal cell carcinoma"}
